passages.text: India | Diversified Industrials

1QFY26 order flow rose \(33\%\) YoY for the coverage universe, led by L&T, BEL, Siemens Energy (SE), and BHEL. Defence order flows rose \(56\%\) YoY. HAL, BEL and SE saw strong margin beats, though margins for overall universe remained flatish with ABB particularly disappointing. Power and defence continue to have the highest visibility ahead. Top picks: SE, HAL, Siemens, L&T, and KEI.

ABB, Siemens (incl. Energy) and Thermax combined saw \(16\%\) YoY order flow growth in 1Q: SE reported \(94\%\) YoY order flow growth reflecting continued strong momentum in power. Siemens ex- Energy's orders rose \(13\%\) YoY including the Rs12 bn bullet train signalling contract. ABB's order flow declined \(12\%\) YoY due to absence of large orders, though base orders rose \(5\%\) YoY. Mgmt. on call highlighted that large orders continued to see deferment, but base order pipeline is healthy. L&T saw \(33\%\) YoY order flow growth led by thermal power orders. Between this and \(63\%\) YoY rise in prospects to Rs15 trn, the company is comfortable to meet its annual \(10\%\) YoY growth guidance as only \(4\%\) growth run- rate is needed in balance 9M. BEL's order flow rose \(53\%\) YoY led by major spares and systems orders. BHEL saw \(33\%\) YoY rise in orders backed by the Bhadla- Fatephur HVDC order won with Hitachi Energy.

Overall margins flatish YoY at \(9.5\%\) ; defence and SE positively surprise: HAL and BEL margins rose 387 bps and 576 bps YoY to \(26.7\%\) and \(28.1\%\) on better gross margins. SE saw strong 469 bps YoY rise in margin to \(19.1\%\) with operating leverage playing out. L&T E&C margins were stable at \(7.6\%\) despite international execution rising \(36\%\) YoY, which should give investors comfort on limited downside risk as international revenues continue to rise. Cummins margin rose 133 bps YoY to \(20.1\%\) driven by operating leverage though gross margin was 67 bps lower YoY at \(35.9\%\) as competitive pressures remain. Siemens ex- Energy margin was down 94 bps YoY at \(11.2\%\) , which reflects in our \(6 - 7\%\) EPS cut in FY25E- 27E.

ABB - disappointing June qtr; washout CY25E, lower PT by \(15\%\) : ABB's 2QCY25 results saw 462 bps YoY drop in gross margins to \(38.2\%\) , driven by a company specific issue of higher imports. Mgmt. on call mentioned that given compliance norms on certain client deliveries were not met, products had to be imported and will see margin impact lasting for 1- 2 quarters. We believe this will keep the stock rangebound, and we have lowered CY25- 27E EPS by \(15\% +\) to factor the same. Potential listing of the Robotics business, which is \(3\%\) of EBIT and will be India's only MNC robust arm listed, is the main upside driver near- term. Details are awaited.

Defence and power stand out on capex visibility; company specific triggers also exist: 1) SE should see \(50\%\) EPS CAGR over FY24- 27E driven by operating leverage and a robust power capex pipeline; 2) HAL has 5- year growth visibility of \(19\%\) EPS CAGR, driven by indigenisation; 3) Siemens (ex- Energy) should benefit from revenue and margin upside on execution of its Rs263 bn locomotive order; 4) L&T - strong visibility with conservative guidance should drive upside; 5) KEI remains a holistic play on power, capex, housing and exports.
Exhibit 1 - Industrials: Earnings growth vs Valuations
Source: Company data, Jefferies estimates
Note: CY24- 27E earnings CAGR and CY25E PE for ABB India; \*FY24- 27E earnings CAGR for Siemens and Siemens Energy (Sept Y/E)
Equity Research August 28, 2025

- Robust power capex pipeline and 3.0x order book to FY24 sales provide strong revenue visibility.- Operating leverage on fixed costs to play out as revenue scales up.
Risk/Reward - 12 Month View

- Siemens Energy should benefit from rising spend on power equipment.- Operating leverage kicking in.- Revenue and PAT CAGR of 34% and 50% over FY24-27E.- FY27E EPS: Rs67; Target PE Multiple: 60x; PT Rs4,000.
- Margins surprise further with better than expected gross margins.- Revenue and PAT CAGR of 34% and 55% over FY24-27E.- FY27E EPS: Rs73; Target PE Multiple: 65x; PT Rs4,750.

- Weak power demand leads to slow power capex.- Fixed costs rise in-line with / faster than revenue leading to limited margin upside.- Revenue and PAT CAGR of 25% and 35% over FY24-27E.- FY27E EPS: Rs48; Target PE Multiple: 55x; PT Rs2,650.

Top Material Issue(s): 1) Materials Sourcing - Siemens has adopted the Basic Conduct Guidelines (BCG), which detail the minimum acceptable ethical and responsible business practices for employees, channel partners, suppliers, vendors, NGOs, and contractors. 2) Energy Management - Siemens has added 49 KW of captive solar energy in 2020. The company replaced all Compact Fluorescent Lamps with Light Emitting Diode light fittings in the Puducherry factory, which helped to save 23.8 MWh of energy, among several other measures. 3) Employee Health & Safety - Industrial operations can be inherently dangerous, and Siemens is focused on this.
Company Targets: 1) Increase green power usage. 2) Recycling of used water.

Qs to Mgmt: 1) What are your commitments in terms of making the environment green? 2) What would be the margin improvement post using sustainable inputs? 3) Are any audits being undertaken at manufacturing facilities/campuses to ensure lower energy utilisation?
- Power capex to grow at 20%+ CAGR over FY25-30E.- Fixed cost leverage driving margin expansion.

Market leader in India defence aircraft manufacturing. FY25 order book 6.1x revenue. Earnings delivery on existing order book with clarity on margin trajectory, with each passing result helping the stock move higher from current levels.
Risk/Reward - 12 Month View

- Visible pipeline of Rs1.5-1.7trn+ giving enough visibility for medium-term revenues. Rising indigenization helps HAL on order flow growth. Sept 27E EPS: Rs178, Target PE multiple: 35x Sept 27E, PT Rs6,220.

- Defence orders move at a faster pace with more proposals being cleared and tenders being floated in the near future. Make in India program gains pace with thrust on a higher proportion of domestic orders being placed. Sept 27E EPS: Rs185, Target PE multiple: 40x Sept 27E, PT Rs7,400.

- Defence spending faces regulatory roadblocks and ordering process slows down. Margin pressure on execution due to indigenous manufacturing proportion moving higher than expected. Sept 27E EPS: Rs150, Target PE multiple: 25x Sept 27E, PT Rs3,750.

Top Material Issues: 1) Materials Sourcing - HAL has established a rigorous mechanism for supplier selection and inclusion in the company's vendor Directory, with the goal of sustainable sourcing and long- term mutual benefit. 2) Energy Management - HAL has taken up sustainable development projects in the areas of energy- efficient retrofitting - LED lights, reducing carbon footprint, and water footprint. 3) Employee Health & Safety - Industrial operations can be inherently dangerous, and HAL has made people, health, and safety a priority, often part of the ESG strategy.

Company Targets: 1) Actively involved in conserving natural resources such as rainwater harvesting, energy conservation, and reduction of waste. 2) Increase the use of electrical energy wheeling from wind energy power.

Questions for Management: 1) What are your commitments to making the environment green? 2) What would be the margin improvement post using sustainable inputs? 3) Are any audits being undertaken at manufacturing facilities/campuses to ensure lower energy utilisation?
- HAL receiving orders at a fast pace and revenue CAGR moving to consistent double-digit growth- Further visibility on export ordering
Investment Thesis / Where We Differ
Further operating leverage to play out. Exports could surprise.
Risk/Reward - 12 Month View

Siemens is a well- diversified company with multiple business drivers across the power, roads, railways, and healthcare sectors, among others. Operating leverage is driving \(13\%\) FY24- 27E EPS CAGR. FY27E EPS: Rs71; Target PE Multiple: \(55x\) PT Rs3,895.

Exports rise at a faster pace to the parent and India becomes a manufacturing hub for the parent exports from India. Margins cross previous peak levels. Asset turnover improves. FY27E EPS: Rs77; Target PE Multiple: \(60x\) PT Rs4,680.

Exports to parent fizzle out and the expected pickup in exports does not come through. Margins show downward surprise. Debtor days and inventory days along with Asset turnover do not improve. FY27E EPS: Rs55; Target PE Multiple: \(45x\) PT Rs2,475.

Top Material Issue(s): 1) Materials Sourcing - Siemens has adopted the Basic Conduct Guidelines (BCG), which detail the minimum acceptable ethical and responsible business practices for employees, channel partners, suppliers, vendors, NGOs, and contractors. 2) Energy Management - Siemens has added 49 KW of captive solar energy in 2020. The company replaced all Compact Fluorescent Lamps with Light Emitting Diode light fittings in the Puducherry factory, which helped to save \(23.8MWh\) of energy, among several other measures. 3) Employee Health & Safety - Industrial operations can be inherently dangerous, and Siemens is focused on this.
Company Targets: 1) Increase green power usage. 2) Recycling of used water.

Qs to Mgmt: 1) What are your commitments in terms of making the environment green? 2) What would be the margin improvement post using sustainable inputs? 3) Are any audits being undertaken at manufacturing facilities/campuses to ensure lower energy utilisation?
Infra pipeline in India materialising into order flows Margin surprise, especially on exports
Margin trajectory to remain strong, given asset sweating on current low utilization levels
Risk/Reward - 12 Month View

ABB India should benefit from the domestic infrastructure spend and a pickup in exports from the Indian market. Exports to parent from India to pick up. RoE to scale back up to double digits. Operating leverage to kick in going forward. CY27E EPS: Rs118; Target P/E: 50x; Price Target Rs5,925.
Margins surprise further. Exports from India rise to \(30\%\) plus of revenues. RoE recovers faster than expected. CY27E EPS: Rs135; Target P/E: 55x; Price Target Rs 7,400.
Slowdown in domestic infrastructure spend. Export growth, due to pickup in exports to parent and group companies, fizzles out. CY27E EPS: Rs102; Target P/E: 40x; Price Target Rs 4,100.

Top Material Issue(s): 1) Materials Sourcing - ABB recycled \(93\%\) of their water utilised vs just \(54\%\) in 2016. 2) Energy Management - ABB's green power usage has risen to \(40\%\) of consumption from just \(0.1\%\) in 2016. 3) Employee Health & Safety - Industrial operations can be inherently dangerous, and ABB has made people and health and safety a priority, often part of the ESG strategy. ABB saw two serious injuries reported in 2021 and says it is committed to bringing it to near zero as far as possible.
Company Targets: 1) Increase green power usage and replace conventional lighting with LEDs to save energy. 2) \(100\%\) Recycling of utilised water from current \(93\%\) .

Qs to Mgmt: 1) What are your commitments around making environment green? 2) What would be the margin improvement post using sustainable inputs? 3) Any audits being undertaken at manufacturing facilities/campuses to ensure lower energy utilisation?
ESG Sector Integration: India Cap Goods
Exports picking up and contributing to revenue growth. Margins returning to previous levels
With the industry in overcapacity, we remain concerned about profitability and hence would prefer to play the theme through other companies
Risk/Reward - 12 Month View

Domestic BTG industry remains in overcapacity in the benign demand environment. Competitive pressures leading to margin decline, and BHEL's high fixed cost is not helping. Government's thrust on renewables may lead to renewable eating into captive power demand. Price Target of Rs185 based on 20x PE Sept 27E.
BHEL manages to maintain margins despite the weak pricing environment given competition. Monetisation of debtors picks up pace. Price Target of Rs275 based on 30x PE Sept 27E.
BHEL continues to see margin deterioration. Order flow and debtor days worsen due to higher competition. Price Target of Rs140 based on 15x PE Sept 27E.

Top Material Issues: 1) Materials Sourcing - The focus on lowering the carbon content in the supply chain and use of recycled materials is being discussed by BHEL. 12 townships of BHEL units declared as Single Use Plastic Free. 2) Energy Management - BHEL avoided 26,118 MT of CO2 equivalent through solar power installations in FY21. 3) Employee Health & Safety - BHEL has made people and health and safety a priority often part of the ESG strategy and targets. BHEL reported zero accidents at sites in FY21.

Company Targets: 1) Further reduce carbon footprint through in- house solar power installations. 2) Optimally manage key aspects of materials, water, energy, emissions. 3) Focus to reduce injury rate among labors and report zero fatalities.

Qs to Mgmt: 1) What are your commitments around making environment green? 2) What would be the margin improvement post using sustainable inputs? 3) Any audits being undertaken at manufacturing facilities/campuses to ensure lower energy utilisation?
ESG Sector Integration: India Cap Goods
Further weakness in margins News flow continuing on aggressive pricing on BTG bids, similar to the NTPC bulk tenders announced during FY11 and FY12
- L&T should benefit from the revival of the capex cycle.- L&T has begun its ROCE/ROE improvement journey from the FY16 bottom.
Risk/Reward - 12 Month View

- L&T's revenue CAGR in FY25-28E is \(16\%\) .- Hydrocarbon segment and heavy engineering should continue to see improving margin trends.- Rising share of domestic execution backed by orders picked up in the past two years, providing margin comfort.- Target consol. E&C EV/EBITDA multiple of 16x Sept 27E; VOI Rs989; PT Rs4,230

- Early recovery in macro investment cycle should see a sharp pickup in the company's order flow and valuations.- Middle East margin contraction factored in does not come through in case of better margin order flow.- Target consol. E&C EV/EBITDA multiple 18x Sept 27E; VOI Rs989; PT Rs4,588
- Domestic order flow does not materialize. Margin contraction is higher than anticipated on ME execution.- Target consol. E&C EV/EBITDA multiple 10x Sept 27E; VOI Rs989; PT Rs3,156.

Top Material Issue(s): 1) Material Sourcing - The focus on lowering the carbon content in the supply chain and the use of recycled materials are being discussed. L&T reduced water consumption intensity by \(16\%\) in FY16-21, despite seeing revenues grow \(5 - 7\%\) of water recycled vs just \(13\%\) in FY16. 2) Energy Management - L&T reduced its GHG emissions by \(5\%\) over FY16-21. 3) Employee Health & Safety - Industrial operations can be inherently dangerous, and L&T has made people and health and safety a priority. L&T reported 25 fatalities among workers in 2021-22.

Company Targets: 1) Increase renewable energy consumption to \(50\%\) by FY26, reducing GHG emissions progressively, and become carbon- neutral by 2040. 2) Reduce injury rate among laborers and report zero fatalities.

Qs to Mgmt: 1) What are your commitments to making the environment green? 2) What would be the margin improvement post using sustainable inputs? 3) Are any audits being undertaken at manufacturing facilities/campuses to ensure lower energy use?
ESG Sector Integration: India Cap Goods
- Infra pipeline in India materialising into order flows- Margin improvement from rise in domestic E&C execution

Market leader in India in defence electronics. Current order book \(3x\) FY25 revenue. Earnings delivery on existing order book with clarity on margin trajectory, with each passing result helping the stock move higher from current levels.
Risk/Reward - 12 Month View

- Visible pipeline of Rs930 bn giving enough visibility for medium-term revenues. Rising indigenization helps BEL on order flow growth. Sept 27E EPS: Rs11.4, Target PE multiple: 40x Sep 27E, PT Rs455.

- Defence orders move at a faster pace with more proposals being cleared and tenders being floated in the near future. Make in India program gains pace with thrust on a higher proportion of domestic orders being placed. Sept 27E EPS: Rs15, Target PE multiple: 45x Sep 27E, PT Rs675.

- Defence spending faces regulatory roadblocks and ordering process slows down. Margin pressure on execution due to projects' proportion moving higher than expected. Sep 27E EPS: Rs9, Target PE multiple: 30x Sep 27E, PT Rs270.

Top Material Issues: 1) Materials Sourcing - BEL has established a rigorous mechanism for supplier selection and inclusion in the company's vendor Directory, with the goal of sustainable sourcing and long- term mutual benefit. 2) Energy Management - BEL has taken up sustainable development projects in the areas of energy- efficient retrofitting - LED lights, reducing carbon footprint, and water footprint. 3) Employee Health & Safety - Industrial operations can be inherently dangerous, and Bharat Electronics has made people, health, and safety a priority, often part of the ESG strategy.

Company Targets: 1) Actively involved in conserving natural resources such as rainwater harvesting, energy conservation, and reduction of waste. 2) Increase the use of electrical energy wheeling from wind energy power.

Questions for Management: 1) What are your commitments to making the environment green? 2) What would be the margin improvement post using sustainable inputs? 3) Are any audits being undertaken at manufacturing facilities/campuses to ensure lower energy utilisation?
ESG Sector Integration: India Cap Goods
- BEL receiving orders at a fast pace and revenue CAGR resuming double-digit growth- ROE rise to previous levels along with a reduction in debtor and inventory days

- Niche sector player in defence electronics.- Current order book 1x FY25 revenue.- Earnings delivery on existing order book with clarity on margin trajectory, with each passing result helping the stock move higher from current levels.
Risk/Reward - 12 Month View

- Visible order book and pipeline giving enough visibility for medium-term revenues.- Rising indigenization and country's export focus helps Data Patterns on order flow growth.- Sept 27E EPS: Rs68, Target PE multiple: 50x Sept 27E, PT Rs3,400.

- Defence orders move at a faster pace with more proposals being cleared and tenders being floated in the near future.- Make in India program gains pace with thrust on a higher proportion of domestic orders being placed.- Sept 27E EPS: Rs60, Target PE multiple: 70x Sept 27E, PT Rs4,200.

- Defence spending faces regulatory roadblocks and ordering process slows down.- Margin pressure on execution due to projects' proportion moving higher than expected.- Sept 27E EPS: Rs50, Target PE multiple: 40x Sept 27E, PT Rs2,000.

Top Material Issues: 1) Materials Sourcing - Data Patterns has established a rigorous mechanism for supplier selection and inclusion in the company's vendor Directory, with the goal of sustainable sourcing and long- term mutual benefit. 2) Energy Management - Data Patterns has taken up sustainable development projects in the areas of energy- efficient retrofitting - LED lights, reducing carbon footprint, and water footprint. 3) Employee Health & Safety - Industrial operations can be inherently dangerous, and Data Patterns has made people, health, and safety a priority, often part of the ESG strategy.

Company Targets: 1) Actively involved in conserving natural resources such as rainwater harvesting, energy conservation, and reduction of waste. 2) Increase the use of electrical energy wheeling from wind energy power.

Questions for Management: 1) What are your commitments to making the environment green? 2) What would be the margin improvement post using sustainable inputs? 3) Are any audits being undertaken at manufacturing facilities/campuses to ensure lower energy utilisation?
- Data Patterns receiving orders at a fast pace and revenue CAGR surprising on the way up- Further visibility on export ordering
- Rise in retail and exports shares in revenue, which have 100-200 bps better margin profile.- KEI to continue to gain market share in retail.
Risk/Reward - 12 Month View
- Earnings CAGR of 22% during FY25-28E.- Retail share in revenue improves from 34% in FY21 to 53% in FY28E.- Sept 27E EPS: Rs121; Target Multiple: 40x Sept 27E; Price Target: Rs4,855.
- Earnings CAGR of 28% during FY25-28E.- EBITDA margin improves over FY25-28E as retail margins surprise on upside.- Sept 27E EPS: Rs 132; Target Multiple: 45x Sept 27E; Price Target: Rs5,925.
- Earnings CAGR of 15% during FY25-28E.- Exports and retail share in revenue deteriorates over FY25 to FY28E.- Sept 27E EPS: Rs111; Target Multiple: 30x Sept 27E; Price Target: Rs3,320.

Top Material Issues: 1) Materials Sourcing - KEI endeavors to achieve an agile manufacturing and supply chain management to maintain a lean cost structure. 2) Energy Management - KEI installed 3.82 MV of rooftop solar in FY21 to utilise alternate source of energy. 3) Employee Health & Safety - Industrial operations can be inherently dangerous, and KEI has made people and health and safety a priority as part of the ESG strategy and targets (e.g., Total Recordable Incident Rate - TRIR).

Company Targets: 1) Increase usage of natural gas instead of diesel and furnace oil. 2) Installation of Sewage Treatment Plant and Zero Liquid Discharge plant for zero water wastage. 3) Focus to reduce injury rate among laborers and report zero fatalities.

Qs to Mgmt: 1) What are your commitments around making environment green? 2) What would be the margin improvement post using sustainable inputs? 3) Any audits being undertaken at manufacturing facilities/campuses to ensure lower energy utilisation?
ESG Sector Integration: India Cap Goods
- GST implementation will narrow the price differential between branded and unbranded- Picking up of capex cycle
Move to green offerings should drive order flow and revenue growth. Margins will surprise driven by operating leverage.
Risk/Reward - 12 Month View

Margins to rise, driven by revenue recovery and operating leverage. Judicious capital allocation. Low working capital remaining intact. Sept 27E EPS: Rs100; Target Multiple: 45x Sept 27E P/E; PT Rs4,500.

Early recovery in the macro investment cycle will lead to earnings surprise as demand will recover faster than expected. Margin improvement from better orders. Subsidiaries turn around faster. Sept 27E EPS: Rs120.0; Target Multiple: 50x Sept 27E P/E; PT Rs6,000.

Aggressive competition from larger diversified players. Margin contraction and a difficult pricing environment. Subsidiaries continue to make losses. Sept 27E EPS: Rs85; Target Multiple: 30x Sept 27E P/E; PT Rs2,550.

Top Material Issues: 1) Materials Sourcing - Thermax is discussing the focus on lowering the carbon content in the supply chain and use of recycled materials. The company has yet to provide material disclosures around the supply chain, though we look forward to this changing in the coming years. 2)

Energy Management - Thermax has \(12\%\) of its energy requirements being met by renewable energy and has reduced emissions by \(25\%\) since 2019. 3) Employee Health & Safety - Thermax has made people and health & safety a priority.

Company Targets: 1) Increase R&D spend towards developing equipment for reducing energy requirements. 2) Focus on reducing injury rate among labourers and report zero fatalities. 3) Increase energy requirements from renewable sources to \(30\%\) from current \(12\%\) .

Qs to Mgmt: 1) How would decarbonisation help improve efficiencies on energy requirements front? 2) What would be the margin improvement post using sustainable inputs? 3) Any audits being undertaken at manufacturing facilities/campuses to ensure lower energy utilisation?
ESG Sector Integration: India Cap Goods
Strong order flow announcements from the industrial capex linked sectors Margin surprise in coming quarters from better revenues
- Afcons is a play on India's infra capex upcycle.- The company's diversified segmental and geographic exposure derisks its business model and widens its opportunity pipeline.
Risk/Reward - 12 Month View
Base Case, INR580, +33%
- PAT CAGR of 25% in FY25-28E.- PT of Rs580 is based on 25x P/E Sept 27E.
Upside Scenario, INR700, +60%
- Margins improve better than expected.- PAT CAGR of 30% in FY25-28E.- PT of Rs700 is based on 28x P/E Sept 27E.
Downside Scenario, INR355, - 19%
- Domestic order flow does not materialize due to slowdown in capex cycle.- PAT CAGR of 12% in FY25-28E.- PT of Rs355 is based on 18x P/E Sept 27E.

Top Material Issues: 1) The company reduced GHG emissions by 54,800 ton via conversion of 110MVA of fossil power to 48MVA of grid power. 2) Reduced total energy consumption to 2.42 mn gigajoules in FY24 vs. 2.70 mn gigajoules in FY23. 3) Recycled over 27% of the total wastewater discharged at project sites in FY24.

Company Targets: 1) Convert all sites from fossil power to grid power to minimize carbon footprint. 2) \(\mathrm{CO_2}\) emissions savings of 275k ton by FY27 vs. 236k ton in FY24. 3) 103 mn ltr of water saved by FY27 vs. 88 mn ltr in FY24.
Qs to Mgmt: 1) Why have there been no investments in alternate sources of energy/energy conservation equipment? 2) How do you plan to increase water savings?
- Continued healthy growth in infrastructure capex- Margin improvement from better execution
CPCB implementation will impact margins. Competitive factors will cap product pricing upside.
Risk/Reward - 12 Month View

Cummins is a leader with \(50\% +\) market share in the technology- intensive mid- and high- Horsepower (HP) gents. Margins have limited upside as CPCB implementation impacts the same apart from competitive pricing pressure. Sept 27E EPS: Rs108; Target Multiple: 25x; Price Target Rs2,700.

Early recovery in the domestic investment cycle will lead to earnings surprise as demand will recover faster than expected. Favorable movement in product mix could lead to margin improvement. Higher exports to parent. Sept 27E EPS: Rs130; Target Multiple: 35x; Price Target Rs4,550.

Prolonged delay in the return of the investment cycle leading to a delay in gents demand pickup in the domestic market. Further slowdown in exports. Power deficit levels in India remaining at lower levels. Sept 27E EPS: Rs85; Target Multiple: 25x; Price Target Rs2,125.

Top Material Issues: 1) Materials Sourcing - The focus on lowering the carbon content in the supply chain and use of recycled materials is being discussed. Cummins' waste recycling rate stood at \(99.996\%\) in FY22. 2) Energy Management - Cummins' installed solar PV plant of 1,800 kWp in FY22 to increase utilisation of renewable energy. 3) Employee Health & Safety - Industrial operations can be inherently dangerous, and Cummins has made people and health and safety priorities, often part of the ESG strategy and targets.

Company Targets: 1) Generate \(25\%\) less waste in facilities and operations as a percentage of revenue. 2) Create a circular lifecycle plan for every part to use less, use better, use again. 3) Focus to reduce injury rate among labors and report zero fatalities.

Qs to Mgmt: 1) What are your commitments around making environment green? 2) What would be the margin improvement post using sustainable inputs? 3) Any audits being undertaken at manufacturing facilities/campuses to ensure lower energy utilisation?
Company maintaining leadership market share Domestic economic environment improving sharply in next 12- 18 months
We would like to thank Darshan Parmar, employee of Evaluerserve Inc., for providing research support services to our preparation of this report.

ABB India is part of the ABB Group of companies that operates in more than 100 countries. ABB India operates in five segments: Power Products, Power Systems, Discrete Automation & Motion, Low- Voltage Products, and Process Automation. With 14 manufacturing facilities and over 550 channel partners, it has a pan- India presence.
Afcons, part of the Shapoorji Pallonji group, is an Indian multinational construction and engineering company specializing in complex infrastructure projects worldwide.

Bharat Electronics Limited (BEL) is an Indian government- owned defence company with about nine factories. It is a market leader in India in advanced electronic products for the Indian Armed Forces. BEL is one of the eight PSUs under Ministry of Defence, Government of India, and has earned the government's Navratna status.

Bharat Heavy Electricals Limited is an integrated power plant equipment manufacturer. The company has a \(62\%\) share in India's total installed generating capacity. Further the company is engaged in the design, engineering, manufacturing, and construction of products for the Power, Transmission, Industry, Transportation, Oil & Gas, and Defense sector.
Data Patterns is a vertically integrated Defense and Aerospace Electronics solutions provider catering to indigenously developed defense products industry.

Siemens Energy India is a part of Siemens Group, which has had a presence for \(160+\) years in 190 regions. Siemens Energy India is a pure- play energy company with presence across Power Transmission (transformers, AIS/GIS, HVDC, etc.), Power Generation (turbine & generator services), and Industrials (steam turbines, energy solutions for process industries).
Hindustan Aeronautics manufactures military aircraft and helicopters for the Indian armed forces.
KEI Industries (KEI) is among the top- four organised players in the Indian cables industry and an EPC player in power T&D.

Cummins India Limited is the largest company of the Cummins Group in India. The company is the leading manufacturer of diesel and gas engines and serves clients in power generation, industrial, and automotive segments. It has a state- of- the- art manufacturing facility in Pune.

Larsen & Toubro Limited is India's largest Engineering and Construction company, with more than seven decades of history. The company has manufacturing facilities in India, China, Oman, and Saudi Arabia. Further, the company has presence in technology and financial sectors.

Siemens Limited is a part of Siemens Group, which has had a presence for 160 years in 190 regions. Siemens Limited operates in three major segments: Industry, Energy and Healthcare. Presently it has 21 manufacturing plants and more than 500 channel partners across India.

Thermax Limited is a USD 1.1 billion company with a presence in 75 countries across Asia Pacific, Africa, Middle East, Europe and the Americas. It provides engineering solutions to the energy and environment sectors. The company has three manufacturing facilities in India and one in China.
ABB LimitedOur PT of Rs5,925 values ABB at 50x CY27E EPS. Risks include a sharp scale- down in exports by the parent and decreasing cost focus.

AfconsWe value Afcons at 25x PE Sept 27E, a 7% discount to our implied target multiple of approx. 27x for L&T's EPC business. Afcons has no presence in defence, which reduces its investor ESG concerns vs L&T. Our Rs580 PT offers 43% potential upside. Downside risks include slowdown in India's capex growth and aggressive project bidding.
Bharat ElectronicsPT of Rs455 values BEL at 40x Sep 27E EPS. Downside risks include defence indigenisation push slowing down and cost- control measures not being sustainable.
Bharat Heavy ElectricalsOur PT of Rs185 is based on 20x PE Sept 27E. Upside risks include BHEL cutting fixed costs aggressively and higher success in EOI monetisation.
Data PatternsPT of Rs3,400 values Data Patterns at 50x Sept 27E EPS. Downside risks include obsolescence of company's technology and lack of management bandwidth diversification.

Siemens Energy IndiaOur PT of Rs4,000 values Siemens Energy at 60x FY27E EPS. Downside risks include fixed costs rising in- line with / faster than revenue growth and weak power demand slowing power capex.
Hindustan AeronauticsPT of Rs6,220 values HAL at 35x Sept 27E EPS. Downside risks include Global OEM tie- ups not giving a material benefit and management slow at ramping up on product side.
KElBuy with a Rs4,855 PT based on 40x PE Sept 27E, at a premium to its 5- year average of 30x. Downside risks include sharp pricing competition in cables.
Cummins India LimitedPrice target of Rs2,700 based on 25x P/E Sept 27E. Upside risks include 1) industry pricing discipline and 2) faster export recovery.
Larsen & ToubroBuy with SOTP- based PT of Rs4,230, valuing the core business at 16x EV/EBITDA Sept 27E. Risks include no prudent capital allocation and government capex focus decreasing.
Siemens LimitedOur PT of Rs3,895 is based on a 55x FY27E PE. Downside risks include fixed costs rise faster than revenue growth and capex cycle trends further weakening.

Thermax LimitedPT of Rs4,500 at 45x PE Sept 27E is a discount to 10- year avg PE of 47x. Downside risks include aggressive competition from larger diversified players and margin contraction in a difficult pricing environment.

Buy - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of \(15\%\) or more within a 12- month period. Hold - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of plus \(15\%\) or minus \(10\%\) within a 12- month period. Underperform - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of minus \(10\%\) or less within a 12- month period. The expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) for Buy rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) or more within a 12- month period as these companies are typically more volatile than the overall stock market. For Hold rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is plus or minus \(20\%\) within a 12- month period. For Underperform rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is minus \(20\%\) or less within a 12- month period.
NR - The investment rating and price target have been temporarily suspended. Such suspensions are in compliance with applicable regulations and/or Jefferies policies.
CS - Coverage Suspended. Jefferies has suspended coverage of this company.
NC - Not covered. Jefferies does not cover this company.

Restricted - Describes issuers where, in conjunction with Jefferies engagement in certain transactions, company policy or applicable securities regulations prohibit certain types of communications, including investment recommendations.
Monitor - Describes securities whose company fundamentals and financials are being monitored, and for which no financial projections or opinions on the investment merits of the company are provided.

Jefferies' methodology for assigning ratings may include the following: market capitalization, maturity, growth/value, volatility and expected total return over the next 12 months. The price targets are based on several methodologies, which may include, but are not restricted to, analyses of market risk, growth rate, revenue stream, discounted cash flow (DCF), EBITDA, EPS, cash flow (CF), free cash flow (FCF), EV/EBITDA, P/E, PE/growth, P/CF, P/FCF, premium (discount)/average group EV/EBITDA, premium (discount)/average group P/E, sum of the parts, net asset value, dividend returns, and return on equity (ROE) over the next 12 months.

Jefferies Franchise PicksJefferies Franchise Picks include stock selections from among the best stock ideas from our equity analysts over a 12 month period. Stock selection is based on fundamental analysis and may take into account other factors such as analyst conviction, differentiated analysis, a favorable risk/reward ratio and investment themes that Jefferies analysts are recommending. Jefferies Franchise Picks will include only Buy rated stocks and the number can vary depending on analyst recommendations for inclusion. Stocks will be added as new opportunities arise and removed when the reason for inclusion changes, the stock has met its desired return, if it is no longer rated Buy and/or if it triggers a stop loss. Stocks having 120 day volatility in the bottom quartile of S&P stocks will continue to have a 15% stop loss, and the remainder will have a 20% stop. Franchise Picks are not intended to represent a recommended portfolio of stocks and is not sector based, but we may note where we believe a Pick falls within an investment style such as growth or value.
